intro: Terminalia prunioides, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and lance-shaped leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by oval, woody fruits containing single seeds. Its wood is valued for its fine texture and durability, making it useful in traditional crafts and construction. The plant also has medicinal uses in some African cultures.
